Example: pointer_arith_algebraic_properties_1_global.c

#include <stdio.h>
int  y[2], x[2];
int main() {
  int *p = (&(x[0]) + &(y[1]))-&(y[0]);
  *p = 11;  // is this free of undefined behaviour?
  printf("x[1]=%d *p=%d\n",x[1],*p);
  return 0;
}
[link to test in Cerberus and Compiler Explorer]
